ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Which one of your Lord's blessings do you then dispute?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So, which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: About which of the bounties of your Lord can they persistently dispute?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So O listener! Which favour of your Lord will you doubt?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then which of the graces of your Lord will you doubt
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Which of your Lord's benefits will you then dispute about?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then which of thy Lord's bounties disputest thou?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: On which then of your Lord's signs do you cast doubt?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Which then of thy Lord's benefits wilt thou doubt?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then which of the bounties of your Lord will you dispute?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then which of the Graces of your Lord (O man!) will you doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So which then of your Lord's favors do you dispute?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:55] Then which of the bounties of your Lord, [which of] His graces, [graces] which indicate His Oneness and power, do you dispute?, do you have doubt about, O man, or deny?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord) which of the blessings of your Lord, man-this refers to all human beings except Muhammad (pbuh)-(canst thou dispute) can you deny that it is not from your Lord?
